title: 115_s1275
content: The Act may be cited as the "Bringing Useful Initiatives for Indian Land Development Act of 2017" or the "BUIILD Act of 2017". This Act also includes provisions for environmental review. Section 105 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to allow tribes to take on additional responsibilities for environmental review when using federal funds for affordable housing projects. The amendment to Section 105 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 allows tribes to assume additional responsibilities for environmental review when using federal funds for affordable housing projects. This includes discharging the responsibility of other Federal agencies for compliance with environmental review requirements. The certification under subsection (c) requires tribes to specify additional responsibilities they have fulfilled and consent to assume liability for the content and quality of the environmental review. If a tribe fails to fulfill responsibilities for a project, remedies and sanctions can be imposed in accordance with regulations. Approval of a statutory violation waiver request can discharge other sources of Federal funds from imposing remedies or sanctions. Section 108 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to authorize appropriations from 2018 through 2025. Additionally, a 99-year leasehold interest in trust or restricted lands for housing purposes is established. Section 702 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to extend leasehold interests to 99 years. Section 703 is also amended to address training and technical assistance. "Authorized funding for training and technical assistance to Indian tribes and housing entities for fiscal years 2018 through 2025. Assistance to be provided to training and technical assistance providers. Loan guarantees for Indian housing also addressed." "Amendment to Section 184(i) of the Housing and Community Development Act of 1992 authorizes $12,200,000 for loan guarantee costs for Indian housing for fiscal years 2018 through 2025. Leveraging provisions also updated." SEC. 7. LEVERAGING. Funds from grants under the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 can be used to meet matching requirements for other programs.
